data.title: Very Clean!
data.text: My daughter and I had to stop as my mothers name was Dotty! My fish sandwich was good my daughters biscuits and gravy was good. What was most impressive was the cleanliness. From menus to salt and pepper shakes to ketchup bottles to the sides of the tables   - the pride taken in maintaining an older restaurant and the care in making sure things were so clean was really very nice !

data.title: Diner in Dubuque
data.text:
A diner on Central Ave., downtown Dubuque, fairly close to the Mississippi River Aquarium.

We had lunch here in July while exploring the upper Mississippi River valley.
It’s a diner, nothing fancy, but has good food at inexpensive prices (total cost for 3 (!) was $22.75 before tip). 

I had the fish sandwich, and it was pretty good.  I also had a cup of home-made chili to add a bit of variety (but not spice - it was not a very spicy chili at all). 

My wife had the pork tenderloin sandwich, and my son had the grilled cheese sandwich (both OK). 

All orders came with fries (krinkle cut – not my favorite), so the lunch was not fantastic, but for the price, it clearly got the job done. 

They also serve breakfast (eggs, omelettes, pancakes, etc. ) but we were hungry for lunch, so can’t rate the breakfast items.

Dottie’s only seems open for breakfast and lunch (and only brunch on Sunday), so don’t seek it out for dinner. Ample parking is all around.

data.title: The Great Way It Use To Be.
data.text: Not many places like this left. A retro 60's restaurant. Food was excellent and filling. Place was packed with only one waitress and she was as fast as the Roadrunner. She not only took care of all her customers, but made coffee and bussed tables on the side. What a woman, she could work for me anytime. Prices were good. You can even by a souvenir t shirt for only $10.00. Our hotel restaurant would have charged us so much more. It's convent , as it is right down town. Great place.

data.title: Local tradition
data.text: Dottie's looks like it's been there forever, and it has.  If you want a taste of local breakfast, this is a great value.  So cheap.  Lots of food. And clean.

data.title: Family friendly
data.text: A traditional local restaurant. The atmosphere is cozy, food is good and plentiful. Waitstaff is friendly and accommodating.

data.title: Classic cafe with charm
data.text: If you're looking to step back in time with 1960's decor and good comfort food, this is your place. Easy walking distance from anywhere in downtown Dubuque, unmistakable exterior that takes you back to a simpler time. Phenomenal wait staff, simple menu with prices that won't empty your travel wallet. Think of your favorite greasy spoon restaurant along the road trip, put it inside an original building with cozy booth / bar seating and this is Dottie's Cafe. Would I return and recommend? Without hesitation. Bill for 3 adults at breakfast with tip, less than $25.

data.title: Old time cafe.
data.text: This had been my go-to for breakfast.  Last time I ordered eggs sunnyside up.  Eggs came and the cook didn't cook long enough to set the whites.  Eggs up doesn't mean don't cook.  Service always good.  Food usually good and great pies.

data.title: Wonderful Staff
data.text: They were very nice to our grandchildren, giving them coloring books.  Our oldest grandson, 9, loved his bacon, eggs with hot sauce, and French Toast.  The coffee was good and it kept coming.  They only thing was ventilation system, you really good smell the burnt toast and other items.

data.title: A Step Back In Time
data.text: In from out of town and enjoyed breakfast at Dottie"s while on our trip.  Arrived at 10:00am on Friday morning and it was jumping. Ordered the breakfast special of 2 eggs, bacon, hash browns and toast for $4.25.  Quite a deal!.  Cheaper than fast food and way more fun.  It's an old time, kitschy little diner that's a must try when in Dubuque.  The waitress was attentive and kept our coffee cups full.  Will be back!

data.title: Great breakfast, great price
data.text:
Felt like we had walked into a 1950's diner but with updated decor.  Didn't get a chance to look up any reviews on the place.  But when we walked in and saw so many people on a Saturday morning, we knew the food would be good.  I like to order eggs over hard and a lot of times they are over cooked.  Dotties cooked them perfectly.
Our hotel offered a pricey breakfast, so glad we took a chance on this diner!

data.title: Good Home Cooked Meal
data.text: We LOVE Dotties!  I can remember going there with my dad when I was young.  Excellent home cooked food, 'neighborhood" feel and prices are great.

data.title: DBQ Diner at it's best
data.text: I love this little place, it will take you back in time (in a good way).  Service is good and the food is great diner style grub.

data.title: We won't return
data.text: We go out of our way to patronize  quaint local establishments. We won't be returning to Dottie's. The food was average but the service was bad enough to sour the experience. I felt like we were an inconvenience to our waitress. I wanted to ask for  water but she was so surly I decided to go without.

data.title: Simple Breakfast
data.text: We wanted a simple breakfast and Dottie's met the need.  The waitress was attentive. The place was clean. The food was typical diner fare at a decent price.

data.title: We only had breakfast
data.text: A fair priced place to go for breakfast if staying at a hotel that does not include breakfast. Food was okay, a regular "Mom and Pop" place.

data.title: Old style classic breakfast
data.text: Although the food here is not bad, its just your typical breakfast fare, such as toast and sausage. The food is acceptable, but with nothing out of the ordinary. The patronage is mostly old retired people, and the staff much the same. I would recommend this place to only people looking for an old style classic breakfast.

data.title: Breakfasts Above and Beyond
data.text: Dottie's is one of the restaurants you want to visit again because of the great food and inexpensive prices.  I've been a frequent breakfast visitor and find Dottie's just the spot for everything from a big bowl of oatmeal to ham and eggs.  Great service and plenty to eat at a great price.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: Nothing fancy but the food was good, coffee always full and waitress was very friendly. It was close to our hotel and quite a few locals which usually means good food.

data.title: Just OK
data.text:
Food was passable but the service was slow.  only about 4 other people but they took forever to take our order and pretty much ignored us after that.
they use a lame cheese sause and maybe a slice of low end cheese on the omlettes.  The american fries were good though.  they should also offer real butter for the toast and such

data.title: Good small town diner.
data.text: Hey, it's fast, cheap and good. Served with a smile and my coffee and water were always full. What more could you ask for?
